meaningMnemonic: If you <radical>compare</radical> <radical>white</radical> light to the other colors you'll realize... white consists of <kanji>all</kanji> the colors in one. It contains all the colors in the spectrum in one color. It is the one color that is <kanji>everything</kanji>.
readingMnemonic: You decide white light is the ultimate color. You decide you want to put it on <kanji>all</kanji> things to make everything white. "What a great idea," you think. You try to put it on everything and you nearly succeed... except, the <reading>miners</reading> (みな). They keep getting dirty doing all their mining things. NOOO, your plan is ruined!
